channel.title: Delphi
channel.description: I was looking to start developing in Delphi, yet I can't find an IDE or anything, that is free. For Java I know you need JRE to run Java applications/code and you need JDK to compile it. Well I was presuming Delphi would be the same, yet when I googled anything related to Delphi it sent me to Embarcadero Delphi, which appears to be an IDE for Delphi. This costs, at the least, 200$. Now surely you don't have to pay money to develop a program in a certain language? Or am I missing something. :P

item.title: Delphi
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:8, topic:403860”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=500922.msg3664507#msg3664507 date=1310531847]
Rather than “reinvent the wheel” I feel it would be less time consuming to start off where he left off. Obviously I wouldn’t just jump right in.
[/quote]
Or learn the data formats and write your own ‘DatMaker’ in another language.[/quote]

[quote=“Echo_, post:9, topic:403860”]Enjoy

http://www.megaupload.com/?d=0VSV4Q9C[/quote]
Thank you so much. <3

Read full topic

item.title: Delphi
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:5, topic:403860”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=500922.msg3664460#msg3664460 date=1310529539]
Why not learn python or a more common language?
[/quote]
The main reason being that I wanted to start developing where MrPotatoHead left off on his DatMaker.

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=340744.0;attach=18096

As you can see it is written in Delphi. He used this: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=61038.0;attach=19851

Which is bentski’s code for RSMV. Rather than “reinvent the wheel” I feel it would be less time consuming to start off where he left off. Obviously I wouldn’t just jump right in. At the very least I was hoping to learn Python eventually, for blender plugins, so I guess I could recreate what has already been done…

Edit: It seems that each file has a duplicate. There’s usually a .pas and a .dcu. I presume .pas is Pascal and .dcu is Delphi?[/quote]
Or learn the data formats and write your own ‘DatMaker’ in another language.

Read full topic

item.title: Delphi
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

xryz:

i use to have turbo delphi, which i believe was free for one computer or something like that. but its no longer free and u have to use only the delphi xe or whatever the 30 day trial is. it seems there is only one company that sells delphi. wiki says delphi is developed in pascal so ya. i would have to guess u have to buy it. if u wanted to im sure its not hard to port to another language like java.

Very easy! Especially since the source is right there

Read full topic

i use to have turbo delphi, which i believe was free for one computer or something like that. but its no longer free and u have to use only the delphi xe or whatever the 30 day trial is. it seems there is only one company that sells delphi. wiki says delphi is developed in pascal so ya. i would have to guess u have to buy it. if u wanted to im sure its not hard to port to another language like java.

item.title: Delphi
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

T4_:

Why not learn python or a more common language?

The main reason being that I wanted to start developing where MrPotatoHead left off on his DatMaker.

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=340744.0;attach=18096

As you can see it is written in Delphi. He used this: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=61038.0;attach=19851

Which is bentski’s code for RSMV. Rather than “reinvent the wheel” I feel it would be less time consuming to start off where he left off. Obviously I wouldn’t just jump right in. At the very least I was hoping to learn Python eventually, for blender plugins, so I guess I could recreate what has already been done…

Edit: It seems that each file has a duplicate. There’s usually a .pas and a .dcu. I presume .pas is Pascal and .dcu is Delphi?

Read full topic

item.title: Delphi
item.dc:creator: @Tu1 Tu
item.description:
@Tu1 wrote:

is this not a multi-purpose language? the only reason i would understand charging people to program is if the language was for a specific purpose that makes developing easier… like blitz basic.

Read full topic

I was looking to start developing in Delphi, yet I can’t find an IDE or anything, that is free. For Java I know you need JRE to run Java applications/code and you need JDK to compile it. Well I was presuming Delphi would be the same, yet when I googled anything related to Delphi it sent me to Embarcadero Delphi, which appears to be an IDE for Delphi. This costs, at the least, 200$. Now surely you don’t have to pay money to develop a program in a certain language? Or am I missing something.
